meanings.definition: A sensation of whirling and loss of balance, associated particularly with looking down from a great height or caused by disease affecting the inner ear.
meanings.sent1: The sudden vertigo made her feel like the room was spinning around her.
meanings.sent2: She experienced vertigo when she looked down from the tall building.
meanings.sent3: His vertigo was so intense that he accidentally bumped into the wall.
meanings.sent4: The vertigo of the situation left her feeling disoriented and dizzy.
meanings.sent5: The vertigo was so strong that she had to sit down to regain her balance.

meanings.definition: A giddy sensation of tilting within stable surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected vertigo made him feel like the ground was shifting beneath his feet.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of vertigo as if the world was tilting slightly.
meanings.sent3: His vertigo was so pronounced that he almost stumbled over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The vertigo of the situation left her feeling lightheaded and unsteady.
meanings.sent5: The vertigo was so intense that it felt like the room was spinning around her.
